Record_string.any_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

Record_string.unknown_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

TenantMetadataResponse.description: Metadata bundle returned when requesting tenant metadata

id.description: Unique identifier for the tenant (mirrors tenantId)

tenantId.description: Duplicate of id for backward compatibility with existing clients

token.description: JWT to authenticate as the tenant

issuerKid.description: Verification method / key id for issuer DID

verifierKid.description: Verification method / key id for verifier DID

Pick_CustomTenantConfig.Exclude_keyofCus.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

Omit_CustomTenantConfig.walletConfig_.description: Construct a type with the properties of T except for those in type K.

baseUrl.description: Optional public base URL for the tenant (used for OpenID endpoints)

displayName.description: Optional human readable display name (used in metadata display objects)

Record_response.string_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

AutoAcceptProof.description: Typing of the state for auto acceptance

ProofFormatDataMessagePayload_ProofForma.description:
Get the format data payload for a specific message from a list of ProofFormat interfaces and a message

For an indy offer, this resolves to the proof request format as defined here:
https://github.com/hyperledger/aries-rfcs/tree/b3a3942ef052039e73cd23d847f42947f8287da2/features/0592-indy-attachments#proof-request-format

Get the format data payload for a specific message from a list of ProofFormat interfaces and a message

For an indy offer, this resolves to the proof request format as defined here:
https://github.com/hyperledger/aries-rfcs/tree/b3a3942ef052039e73cd23d847f42947f8287da2/features/0592-indy-attachments#proof-request-format

Get the format data payload for a specific message from a list of ProofFormat interfaces and a message

For an indy offer, this resolves to the proof request format as defined here:
https://github.com/hyperledger/aries-rfcs/tree/b3a3942ef052039e73cd23d847f42947f8287da2/features/0592-indy-attachments#proof-request-format

HandshakeProtocol.description:
Enum values should be sorted based on order of preference. Values will be
included in this order when creating out of band invitations.

Pick_JwsGeneralFormat.Exclude_keyofJwsGe.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

Omit_JwsGeneralFormat.payload_.description: Construct a type with the properties of T except for those in type K.

AttachmentData.description: A JSON object that gives access to the actual content of the attachment

base64.description: Base64-encoded data, when representing arbitrary content inline instead of via links. Optional.

json.description: Directly embedded JSON data, when representing content inline instead of via links, and when the content is natively conveyable as JSON. Optional.

links.description: A list of zero or more locations at which the content may be fetched. Optional.

jws.description: A JSON Web Signature over the content of the attachment. Optional.

sha256.description: The hash of the content. Optional.

description.description: An optional human-readable description of the content.

filename.description: A hint about the name that might be used if this attachment is persisted as a file. It is not required, and need not be unique. If this field is present and mime-type is not, the extension on the filename may be used to infer a MIME type.

mimeType.description: Describes the MIME type of the attached content. Optional but recommended.

lastmodTime.description: A hint about when the content in this attachment was last modified.

byteCount.description: Optional, and mostly relevant when content is included by reference instead of by value. Lets the receiver guess how expensive it will be, in time, bandwidth, and storage, to fully fetch the attachment.

Pick_CreateLegacyInvitationConfig.Exclud.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

Omit_CreateLegacyInvitationConfig.routin.description: Construct a type with the properties of T except for those in type K.

Pick_ReceiveOutOfBandInvitationConfig.Ex.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

Omit_ReceiveOutOfBandInvitationConfig.ro.description: Construct a type with the properties of T except for those in type K.

CredentialState.description: Issue Credential states as defined in RFC 0036 and RFC 0453

attributeName.description: The name that will be used to generate the linked credential

attachment.description: The attachment that needs to be linked to the credential

Pick_AnonCredsProposeCredentialFormat.Ex.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

Omit_AnonCredsProposeCredentialFormat.sc.description: Construct a type with the properties of T except for those in type K.

LegacyIndyProposeCredentialFormat.description:
This defines the module payload for calling CredentialsApi.createProposal
or CredentialsApi.negotiateOffer

NOTE: This doesn't include the `issuerId` and `schemaIssuerId` properties that are present in the newer format.

W3cIssuerOptions.description: TODO: check how to support arbitrary data in class

JsonLdCredentialDetailFormat.description: Format for creating a jsonld proposal, offer or request.

AnonCredsProposeCredentialFormat.description:
This defines the module payload for calling CredentialsApi.createProposal
or CredentialsApi.negotiateOffer

CredentialFormatPayload_CredentialFormat.description: Get the payload for a specific method from a list of CredentialFormat interfaces and a method

AutoAcceptCredential.description: Typing of the state for auto acceptance

AnonCredsAcceptProposalFormat.description: This defines the module payload for calling CredentialsApi.acceptProposal

Record_string.never_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

CredentialFormatPayload_CredentialFormat.description: Get the payload for a specific method from a list of CredentialFormat interfaces and a method

AnonCredsOfferCredentialFormat.description:
This defines the module payload for calling CredentialsApi.offerCredential
or CredentialsApi.negotiateProposal

CredentialFormatPayload_CredentialFormat.description: Get the payload for a specific method from a list of CredentialFormat interfaces and a method
Get the payload for a specific method from a list of CredentialFormat interfaces and a method

AnonCredsAcceptOfferFormat.description:
This defines the module payload for calling CredentialsApi.acceptOffer. No options are available for this
method, so it's an empty object

CredentialFormatPayload_CredentialFormat.description: Get the payload for a specific method from a list of CredentialFormat interfaces and a method

AnonCredsAcceptRequestFormat.description:
This defines the module payload for calling CredentialsApi.acceptRequest. No options are available for this
method, so it's an empty object

JsonLdAcceptRequestFormat.description:
Format for accepting a jsonld credential request. Optionally allows the verification
method to use to sign the credential.

CredentialFormatPayload_CredentialFormat.description: Get the payload for a specific method from a list of CredentialFormat interfaces and a method

DidExchangeState.description: Connection states as defined in RFC 0023.

Record_content.string_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

DidCreateResponse.description: Response for DID creation or preparation endpoints.

servedFromCache.description: Whether the did document was served from the cache

servedFromDidRecord.description: Whether the did document was served from a local did record

DIDDocumentMetadata.description: Represents metadata about the DID document resulting from a {@link Resolvable.resolve} operation.

proofType.description:
The proofType to be used for signing the credential.

Must be a valid Linked Data Signature suite.

verificationMethod.description:
URI of the verificationMethod to be used for signing the credential.

Must be a valid did url pointing to a key.

Pick_W3cJsonLdSignCredentialOptions.Excl.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

Omit_W3cJsonLdSignCredentialOptions.form.description: Construct a type with the properties of T except for those in type K.

Partial_W3cCredentialValidations_.description: Make all properties in T optional

isValid.description:
Whether the verification as a whole is valid. This means that
all validations inside the validations object should have passed.

error.description:
Error that was caught during verification not related to
any of the specific validations that are performed

Pick_LinkedDataProofOptions.Exclude_keyo.description: From T, pick a set of properties whose keys are in the union K

Omit_LinkedDataProofOptions.cryptosuite_.description: Construct a type with the properties of T except for those in type K.

verifyCredentialStatus.description: Whether to verify the credentialStatus, if present.

This is useful for non-tenant offers that reference the base server as issuer.

Creates an outbound out-of-band record in the same way how `createInvitation` method does it,
but it also converts out-of-band invitation message to an "legacy" invitation message defined
in RFC 0160: Connection Protocol and returns it together with out-of-band record.

post.description:
Revoke an issued credential (Admin)
Credo generic credentials module does not support 'revocation' (ledger/status list) directly via this API yet.
We will perform a local delete to prevent further usage from this agent's perspective.
